intro: Lophiolepis sommieri, commonly known as the Sommier's lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically pale yellow to orange in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga or cyanobacterium, which allows it to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is often found on rock surfaces in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique structure and habitat, it plays an important role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
